name: Free Google Reviews widget by OpenWidget
author: text.com

sections.description:
WordPress Free Google Reviews widget by OpenWidget

Free Google Reviews widget for WordPress is a free plugin allowing you to enhance your online credibility and convert visitors into customers.

Why do you need a free Google Reviews widget for your WordPress?

– Enhance your online credibility and reputation

Incorporating a Google Reviews widget into your WordPress website can notably boost your digital credibility and position. By presenting social validation to prospective clients, you exhibit genuine ratings from people who trusted you before. This openness fosters reliance and assurance in your brand, leading to higher rates of conversion in the end.

– Convert visitors into customers

Incorporating the Google Reviews widget directly on your website saves visitors the hassle of navigating away to search for reviews manually. This seamless experience keeps users engaged and encourages them to further explore your products or services. By providing easy access to reviews, you streamline the decision-making process for your visitors, making it more likely for them to convert into customers.

How does a free Google Reviews widget for your WordPress work?

After adding it to your WordPress, the free Google Reviews widget manifests as a tab that emerges after a five-second delay. It showcases your overall rating, the total count of reviews, and a hyperlink guiding visitors to your Google Business Profile page. Positioned by default at the lower right corner, it effortlessly harmonizes with your site’s visual appeal. With the help of the OpenWidget Management App, you have the flexibility to adjust its placement to your preference, in addition to configuring the business displayed in the Google Reviews widget itself. There you can also see how the Google Reviews widget added to your WordPress will look like.

The Google Reviews widget will also be accessible to your customers every time they launch OpenWidget by simply clicking on a bubble.

Notes

Requirements

Our WordPress Google Reviews Plugin is available to you for free and without any additional requirements except for the technical requirements listed at the beginning of this page.

Localization

Free Google Reviews for WordPress is currently available in English. You can translate the plugin into any language at translate.wordpress.org.

Documentation and Support

  • For documentation and configuration tutorials, visit our official Help Center.
  • Check out our official website for more information about the Google Reviews widget and other features ofered by OpenWidget.

About OpenWidget

Building relationships with your customers is tough. With so many touchpoints handled by so many tools, anything that can go wrong will go wrong, right?

OpenWidget was made to fix that.

Driven by growth and powered by simplicity, it lets you get in touch with potential customers without getting lost in overcomplicated solutions.

We are a part of text|

A company focused on helping brands provide better customer service at scale by analyzing, enriching, and automating text communication. You can learn more at Text.com.

In addition to OpenWidget, Text| ecosystem of products includes:

– LiveChat – a communication tool that allows you to chat live with your customers.
– HelpDesk – an online ticketing system suitable both for small businesses and enterprise clients.
– ChatBot – a bot framework for AI chat bots.
– Open Messaging Platform – create and monetize apps or build extensions for your own team.
– KnowledgeBase – a public Help Center widget

Use of a Third-Party or External Service

Our Free Google Reviews Widget by OpenWidget relies on third-party services to provide full functionality for customers. 3rd party services are used to:

  • Create an account with OpenWidget and log in to the OpenWidget Management Application – a place where customers can configure their Free Google Reviews Widget plugin.
  • Load the widget’s script from our Content Delivery Network and display it on a WordPress website.
  • Load the configuration and apply it to the widget added to a WordPress website.

Here are the URL addresses of third-party services used by Free Google Reviews Widget by OpenWidget:

  • https://accounts.livechat.com
  • https://cdn.openwidget.com
  • https://app.openwidget.com
  • https://api.openwidget.com

The use of those services is regulated by our official Terms of Use and Privacy Policy documents. Please note that all of those services, as well as OpenWidget itself, are part of a text| company.
sections.installation:
Automated Installation

  1. Go to your WordPress admin dashboard, then find the Plugins menu.
  2. Click on Add New and search for Free Google Reviews widget by OpenWidget.
  3. Activate the Google Reviews plugin through the Plugins menu in WordPress.
  4. Go to the free Google Reviews by OpenWidget menu on the left.
  5. Create a new account or sign in if you already have an OpenWidget account.

Manual Installation

  1. Upload the free-google-reviews-widget-by-openwidget zip file to the WordPress plugins directory (/wp-content/plugins/).
  2. Activate the Google Reviews plugin through the Plugins menu in WordPress.
  3. Go to the free Google Reviews by OpenWidget menu on the left.
  4. Create a new account or sign in if you already have an OpenWidget account.
sections.faq:
Do I need an OpenWidget account to use the free Google Reviews plugin?

Yes, you can sign up for a free account at OpenWidget.com

Is there any hidden cost to install or use the plugin?

Not at all! You can use all of the OpenWidget’s functionality for free, including the Google Reviews widget as well as other features offered by OpenWidget.

Can I use OpenWidget plugin on multiple websites?

Sure! We do not limit the number of websites on which you can install the free Google Reviews plugin.

Is the widget customizable?

Yes. We offer the option to customize the widget’s logo, your avatar, the widget’s theme and position on your website.
